hours_text:
Located at the heart of Santa Clara University's campus, adjacent to [Mission Santa Clara de Asís](/missionchurch/), the de Saisset Museum offers **free** admission to all. The museum's [exhibition schedule](/desaisset/exhibitions/current/) aligns with the University's academic calendar. Our galleries are open to the public when undergraduate classes are in session, but tend to be closed during off periods, such as the Christmas holidays, summer, and spring break. Please check our [Hours & Admission](/desaisset/about/visit/hours/) page for specific information regarding scheduled museum closures.

#### [Hours & Admission](/desaisset/about/visit/hours/)

The de Saisset Museum offers **free admission** to everyone, all the time. Throughout the years, our galleries experience scheduled closures. Please check our [hours](/desaisset/about/visit/hours/) before your visit to ensure we are open.

#### [Directions & Parking](/desaisset/about/visit/parking/)

Find out the quickest way to reach us and where to [park](/desaisset/about/visit/parking/) when you arrive.

Looking for other things to do in the area around Santa Clara University?

  * Discover more things to do in this [Kayak guide](https://www.kayak.com/Santa-Clara.33354.guide).

accessibility_text:
Access. For everyone.

Santa Clara University is committed to providing equal access to technology and information. In order to ensure the accessibility of online materials, including webpages, video, audio, and other media, we have committed to the following:

  * The adoption of Santa Clara University's Accessibility Policy.
  * Easy ways to request accessible media or materials and report accessibility issues.
  * Resources for content publishers to make their content accessible.
  * Transparency in reporting of accessibility issues and our efforts to resolve them.

We believe that product accessibility as at the core of well-designed and usable products. If you have suggestions for improving our accessibility efforts, we welcome the opportunity to hear how we can improve your experience.

* * *

## Report Issues or Request Accessible Media

Help us improve the accessibility of our website by voluntarily reporting accessibility issues. We will work quickly to identify and resolve the issue. As part of our commitment to providing equal access to media, we will provide accessible versions of content upon request. Email [accessibility@scu.edu](mailto:accessibility@scu.edu)

[Report an Accessibility Barrier](https://www.scu.edu/ada-504/report-a-campus-barrier/)

## Campus Resources to Make Content Accessible

  * [UDoit](/is/academic-technology/technology-enhanced-teaching/tools/udoit/): Automatically scans Camino course content and walks instructors through a series of steps ...
collections_text:
## **DISCOVER fascinating exhibitions**.  
**EXPERIENCE thought-provoking programs**.   
**BE INSPIRED by California art and history.**

Rotating Images: _SOMOS_ , 2024, Ana Teresa Fernández collaborative project with SCU students, faculty, and staff as part of her residency as a SCU/Montalvo Arts Center Lucas Fellow. Students gathered in the de Saisset Museum to view artworks purchased through the Class Acquisition Project program. Mercedes Dorame, _Smoke to Water_ , 2013, _Balance_ , 2010, archival prints, de Saisset Museum permanent collection, Santa Clara University, works selected by students in SCU Professor Mario Caro's winter 2018 class, ARTH 147: Native Women in Contemporary Arts. Funds for this purchase were made possible by the Hearst Foundation's Community Initiatives for the Visual Arts grant (CIVA), 2018.4.3 and 2018.4.1. Students gathered at the de Saisset Museum for a Spark seminar. Bryan Ida, _Manzanar_(detail), 2020, ink on panel, de Saisset Museum permanent collection, Santa Clara University, Gift of the Artist, 2021.2.
